title: Celtic looking lettering style of a Maori prophet
content:
Hi there, i'm researching the style of a particular lettering style of a Maori prophet (in New Zealand, obviously). The lettering stlye seems to be of some european inspiration... celtic, maybe? It looks quite familiar, but I can't quite pick it. It is quite inconsistent, but I recognise some character designs, and would appreciate if anyone could point me in the right direction for other source material.

Regards,

- Chris

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 2.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415103210/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%202_2.pdf) | 175 KB |
author: Chris Washer

comments.content:
The A’s are quite Basque/Celtic in style, these might help  
 [http://typophile.com/node/29311](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415103210/http:/typophile.com/node/29311 "http://typophile.com/node/29311")

[http://typophile.com/node/19079](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415103210/http:/typophile.com/node/19079 "http://typophile.com/node/19079")

Tim

I recently took this pictures which have a similar A, I don't have a date for the building, the windows look 1930s but I doubt they are original.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415103210im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hat_factory_5417.jpg)

Tim

_Edit: I meant to say the building is off Oxford Street in London_

A modern interpretation, closer to Tim's sample than Chris':

Epitaph, from Font Bureau  
 [http://fontbureau.com/fonts/Epitaph](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415103210/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/Epitaph "http://fontbureau.com/fonts/Epitaph")
